channel.title: PI commands help

item.title: PI commands help
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

[quote=“мonster”][quote author=giveitup link=action=profile;u=432729 date=1311037051]
yes could u make this command for me real quick please.
[/quote]
I was hoping you could use what I wrote as reference and create it yourself. Don’t be afraid to try, you’ll be suprised how easy it is once you get it right.

A part of the fun is tampering around with a couple of errors, trial and error-ing, seeing what works, learning…[/quote]
^This is what I believe in.

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands help
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

So, if SkillXP is equals/more than ((275000), 0) or SkillXP is equals/more than ((275000), 2) or etc. then sendMessage(“You already have over 275k XP.”); otherwise “do the command”.

Basically… now put that in to Java, you might learn something.

Read full topic

item.title: PI commands help
item.dc:creator: @giveitup giveitup
item.description:
@giveitup wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“pure”) && c.pure == 0) {
int i = 0;
c.getPA().addSkillXP((275000), 0);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((275000), 2);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((275000), 3);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((275000), 4);
c.getPA().addSkillXP((275000), 6);
c.playerXP[3] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(60)+5;
c.playerLevel[3] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3]);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(3);
c.pure = 1;
}

need to add so if you have over 275k in skills 0,2,3,4,6 then it will pop up with a message saying “You are currently over the Pure Given Xp.” and it will not give you the xp.

Read full topic
